pr_title: Display user friendly messages for Json Schema validation failures

timeline.bodyText: Let's add javadoc for all of these new classes.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if we can do something stronger here.  I wonder if we can parse the expression with FIQL/RSQL parser.  A regex is not expressive enough to capture all the legal values.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText:
This comment doesn't capture the breadth of what the user can define.  The semi-colon can also be a comma.  Each operator has its own rules.
I think a pointer to the RSQL documentation might be better than trying to redefine here.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText:
This might have been too simplistic.  Check out:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5205339/regular-expression-matching-fully-qualified-class-names
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Something simple here might be better:  "[%s] is not a valid Java class name."
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText:
Neither of them is also an option.
I would reword: "tableSource and values cannot both be defined for a dimension.  Choose one or none."
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Why do we define toString here but nowhere else?
timeline.author: aklish

replies.bodyText: this one extends AbstractKeywordValidator which has abstract toString method. Others extends AbstractFormatAttribute which doesn't have toString method.
replies.author: rishi-aga

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to validate that we have an object node here?  Do we need to check for fields that are not tableSource or values?
timeline.author: aklish

replies.bodyText: Constructor verifies the type of node.
replies.author: rishi-aga

timeline.bodyText: You can provide a URL fragment (https://something.com#fragment) to link to a section in the documentation.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.message: Display user friendly messages for Json Schema validation failures
